an5.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an5.1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
an5.1:2.1: “Mendicants, there are these five powers of a trainee.
an5.1:2.3: The powers of faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.
an5.1:2.4: These are the five powers of a trainee.
an5.1:3.1: So you should train like this:
an5.1:3.2: ‘We will have the trainee’s powers of faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.’
an5.1:3.4: That is what the Buddha said.
an5.1:3.5: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.
